metadata.dc:title: Current status of renal transplant in the child
metadata.dc:creator: Martínez Urrutia, M. J
metadata.dc:description: Paediatic renal transplantation has become the therapy of choice for children with end stage renal disease. Over the last three decades, patient and graft survival rates have improved dramatically. The most common cause of renal graft loss is chronic rejection. Overall mortality has decrease to 6.5 in the first five years port-transplant. The most frequent causes of death related to renal transplant are infection and cardiovascular complications. Future challenges for paediatric transplant programs include chronic rejection, disease recurrence, long outcome, and reduction of immunosuppressive treatment and its side effects (AU)
